about half a dozen <lb n="c57-0117_main_9"/>men came forward and one being selected <lb n="c57-0117_main_10"/>by the magistrate <retrace cause="unclear">he</retrace> deposed that he had been <lb n="c57-0117_main_11"/>out fishing the night before with his son &<lb n="c57-0117_main_12"/>his brother-in-law, Daniel Nugent, when <lb n="c57-0117_main_13"/>about nine o clock they observed a strong <lb n="c57-0117_main_14"/>northerly blast rising & they accordingly put <lb n="c57-0117_main_15"/>in for port. It was a very dark night as <lb n="c57-0117_main_16"/>the moon had not yet risen; They did not <lb n="c57-0117_main_17"/>lan<add place="intralinear">d</add> at the harbour but, as they had been <lb n="c57-0117_main_18"/>accustomed, at a creek about two miles <lb n="c57-0117_main_19"/>below. He went first carrying a part <lb n="c57-0117_main_20"/>of the fishing tackle & his companions <lb n="c57-0117_main_21"/>followed him at some distance. As he <lb n="c57-0117_main_22"/>was walking along the sands he <del rend="strikethrough">hit</del><add hand="#pbs" place="superlinear">struck</add> his foot <lb n="c57-0117_main_23"/>against somthing & fell all his length on <lb n="c57-0117_main_24"/>the ground; his comrades came up to assist <lb n="c57-0117_main_25"/>him & by the light of their lantern they <lb n="c57-0117_main_26"/>discovered that he had fallen on the <lb n="c57-0117_main_27"/>body of a man who was to all appearance <lb n="c57-0117_main_28"/>dead.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0117_main_29"/>Their first supposition was that <lb n="c57-0117_main_30"/>it was the corpse of <del rend="strikethrough">man</del><add hand="#pbs" place="superlinear">some person</add> who had been <lb n="c57-0117_main_31"/>drowned & thrown on shore by the waves, <lb n="c57-0117_main_32"/>But upon examination they found that <lb n="c57-0117_main_33"/>the clothes were not wet &<add place="sublinear"><metamark function="insert">^</metamark></add><add place="superlinear">even</add> that the body <lb n="c57-0117_main_34"/>was not yet cold. They instantly carried <lb n="c57-0117_main_35"/>it to the cottage of an old woman <lb n="c57-0117_main_36"/>near <add hand="#pbs" place="superlinear">the spot</add>& endeavoured <add place="sublinear"><metamark function="insert">^</metamark></add><add hand="#pbs" place="superlinear">but in vain</add> to restore it to life <del rend="strikethrough">but</del></zone> </surface>

gone.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0119_main_3"/>Several other men <del rend="strikethrough">deposed con</del><lb n="c57-0119_main_4"/>were examined concerning my landing & they <lb n="c57-0119_main_5"/>agreed that with the strong north wind that <lb n="c57-0119_main_6"/>had arrisen during the night it was very <lb n="c57-0119_main_7"/>probable that I had beaten about for <lb n="c57-0119_main_8"/>many hours & have been obliged to return <lb n="c57-0119_main_9"/><anchor xml:id="c57-0119.01"/><zone corresp="#c57-0119.01" type="left_margin"><lb n="c57-0119_c57-0119.01_1"/><add>nearly </add></zone>to the same <del rend="strikethrough">place</del><add place="sublinear"><metamark function="insert">^</metamark></add><add place="superlinear">spot</add> from which I had <lb n="c57-0119_main_10"/><del rend="strikethrough">set out</del> departed. of the <lb n="c57-0120_main_2"/>affair.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0120_main_3"/>I entered the room where the <del rend="strikethrough">body</del><add place="superlinear">corpse</add> lay <lb n="c57-0120_main_4"/>& was led up to the coffin.
